name: Raging Kavu
text:
Flash
Haste

name: Raging Minotaur
text: Haste

editions.flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.
The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.
Some tried cremating their dead to stop the ghoulcallers. But the dead returned, furious about their fate.

name: Raging Ravine
text:
Raging Ravine enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Raging Ravine becomes a 3/3 red and green Elemental creature with "Whenever this creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it." It's still a land.

name: Raging River
text: Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, each defending player divides all creatures without flying he or she controls into a "left" pile and a "right" pile. Then, for each attacking creature you control, choose "left" or "right." That creature can't be blocked this combat except by creatures with flying and creatures in a pile with the chosen label.

name: Raging Spirit
text: {2}: Raging Spirit becomes colorless until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Its burning power is more elusive than shade on the Unyaro Plains, more perilous than the horn of a rhino."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Rag Man
text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

editions.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"
"Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"
"Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

He hunts what might have been.

name: Ragnar
text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: "On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."
"On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."

name: Raid Bombardment
text: Whenever a creature you control with power 2 or less attacks, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to defending player.

editions.flavor: Goblins in the first wave of a fire raid always bemoan the aim of everyone else.

name: Raiders' Spoils
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay 1 life. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"To conquer is to eat."
—Edicts of Ilagra

name: Raiding Nightstalker
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Raiding Party
text:
Raiding Party can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
Sacrifice an Orc: Each player may tap any number of untapped white creatures he or she controls. For each creature tapped this way, that player chooses up to two Plains. Then destroy all Plains that weren't chosen this way by any player.

name: Rainbow Crow
text:
Flying
{1}: Rainbow Crow becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.

name: Rainbow Efreet
text:
Flying
{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
"A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."
—Teferi

name: Rainbow Vale
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of knights' quests.
In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of Knights' quests.

name: Rain of Blades
text: Rain of Blades deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

editions.flavor: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.
Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.
Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

name: Rain of Daggers
text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

editions.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.
Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.

name: Rain of Embers
text: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: There's plenty to talk about in the marketplaces of Ravnica, be it the latest feud between guilds or the terrible weather.

name: Rain of Filth
text: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "Sacrifice this land: Add {B} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor:
"When I say it rained, it was not small drops, but a thick, greasy drool pouring from the heavens."
—Urza, journal

name: Rain of Gore
text: If a spell or ability would cause its controller to gain life, that player loses that much life instead.

editions.flavor:
"Stay indoors, away from what seeps over the thresholds. This is the Demon's work, and only ill can come of it."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern

name: Rain of Rust
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target land.
Entwine {3}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

editions.flavor: On Mirrodin, mages who call upon the power of rust are shunned by their people and often turn mercenary to survive.

name: Rain of Salt
text: Destroy two target lands.

editions.flavor:
It pelts the land with its fury,
spoiling what was once sweet.
Here, rain does not wash the land; it desiccates it.

name: Rain of Tears
text: Destroy target land.

editions.flavor:
"These rains cannot quench; they carve the land's face like a scalpel on flesh."
—Crovax
Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.
When emotions rain down, what rivers will be born?

"When mortals die, they have family, friends, compatriots to mourn them. When the land dies, all else dies with it, and there is no one left to weep."
—Jacinth, Skyshroud ranger

name: Rain of Thorns
text:

• Destroy target land.

—Roon Ghastbark

name: Rakish Heir

editions.flavor: "If you're not having fun, what's the point of living forever?"

name: Rakka Mar
text:
Haste
{R}, {T}: Create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with haste.

editions.flavor:
"The finest pawns are those with pawns of their own."

Vigilance

editions.flavor: "Death fills me and makes me strong. You, it will reduce to nothing."

Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)

editions.flavor: Debts to rakshasa linger beyond death.

text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "Every failure, every death only makes my strength greater."

name: Rakshasa's Secret
text: Target opponent discards two cards. Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: The voice of a rakshasa is soft, its breath sweet. But every word is the murmur of madness.

name: Ranger's Path
text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The forest can seem like a dense maze. Those who travel the canopy know otherwise.

name: Rank and File
text: When Rank and File enters the battlefield, green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Left, right, left, right . . . hmm. Okay—left, left, left, left, . . ."

name: Ransack
text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

name: Rapacious One
text:
Trample
Whenever Rapacious One deals combat damage to a player, create that many 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."
